alert.note: Alert for Flathead; Lake; Lincoln; Mineral; Missoula; Sanders (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 19 at 11:34AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT... The Montana Department of Environmental Quality has issued an air quality alert for Flathead, Lake, Lincoln, Mineral, Missoula, and Sanders counties in effect until 12PM 8/20/2023 This alert will be updated again at 12PM 8/20/2023. An Air Quality Alert means that particulates have been trending upwards and that an exceedence of the 24 hour National Ambient Air Quality Standard (NAAQS) has occurred or may occur in the near future. As of 11AM, Particulate levels in Libby are Unhealthy As of 11AM, Particulate levels in Flathead Valley are Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups As of 11AM, Particulate levels in Broadus, Butte, Dillon, Frenchtown, Lewistown, Billings, Miles City, Malta, Missoula, Great Falls, Hamilton, Helena, Sidney, Seeley Lake, Thompson Falls are Moderate When air quality is Unhealthy... State and local health officials recommend that people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly, and children should avoid prolonged exertion; everyone else should limit prolonged exertion. When air quality is Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups... State and local health officials recommend that people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should limit prolonged exertion. When air quality is Moderate... State and local health officials recommend that unusually sensitive people should consider reducing prolonged or heavy exertion. For more information visit the Montana Department of Environmental Quality at http://todaysair.mtdeq.us
